Context: The Next Step in AI Interaction

Instead of a rigid back-and-forth of typed chat, developers can now use real voice input and output.

Final Thoughts

AI interactions have come a long way, from simple text-based chatbots to intelligent voice agents that understand, process, and respond in real time. OpenAI’s latest audio models push this even further, making conversations with AI feel more natural than ever.

Whether transcribing speech with near-human accuracy, generating expressive voices or enabling real-time voice agents, these tools shape how we interact with technology.

The shift is clear: AI started as text, evolved into chat, and now, it’s stepping fully into voice. And with each step, it gets closer to feeling like a real conversation.
